AdditionalFields.Value: Tumor Biology,Bioinformatics / Computational Biology / Systems Biology / Convergent Science

Description: During cancer progression, the tumor microenvironment is subject to dynamic changes in forces arising from extracellular matrix re-organization and altered fluid flows. Such forces impact a number of pro and anti-cancer processes, including the immune response and metastasis. In this session, we will explore methods to measure, model, and understand the role that these factors play in cancer progression and how they can be leveraged for advancing cancer treatment.
SearchResultBody: MW015. Engineered Model Systems for Cancer Research: A Focus on Fluid Flows and Matrix Organization
Title: Engineered Model Systems for Cancer Research: A Focus on Fluid Flows and Matrix Organization
